subject: AI & Agents
title: Popularity Bias: Rich Get Richer
description: A micro-lesson that makes Popularity Bias: Rich Get Richer usable.

hook.text: The top 1% of items get 80% of all recommendations. The long tail starves.

buildup.text: Popular items have more data, so models recommend them more, which generates more data.

discovery.text: This feedback loop amplifies existing popularity and suppresses new or niche content.

twist.text: Long-tail items often have higher satisfaction when users find themâ€”they're just never shown.

climax.text: Countermeasures: inverse propensity weighting, causal debiasing, and popularity-adjusted training.

punchline.text: Recommend the hidden gems, not just the hits.

quiz.question: What is popularity bias in recommendations?
options: Popular items are recommended disproportionately more due to feedback loops
Popularity has no effect on recommendations
